Jonathan Horst | Digital Art Director / Visual Designer

I'm Jonathan Horst an independent digital art director and visual designer. I also consult on customer-centric design for e﻿-﻿commerce. I'm a web design, print design and photography lover.

I get stoked interacting with people who care deeply about design and art. Who love both vision and detail. Who embrace the characteristics of material, medium and platform.

Past clients include artists, musicians, boutique shops, and globally recognized fashion brands.

  • More about the work
  • More about Jonathan

I help brands communicate: to interface visually and experientially with their audience. The goal? Brands building rich and long﻿-﻿term relationships.

I've worked with nonprofits, professional musicians, fine artists, multi-generation family businesses, boutique and global brands.

Since 2014, I've been operating in the e﻿-﻿commerce space. For over two years, I worked closely with globally recognized, U.S. based fashion brand BALDWIN. In collaboration with their marketing and art departments, I designed, developed and implemented several new aspects of their website.

A sample of projects included:

  • An editorial blog with dozens of stories
  • A custom checkout experience
  • An on﻿-﻿boarding experience for a box subscription service
  • An interactive denim fit guide

These initiatives supported strategies to tap new market opportunities, expand brand awareness, increase customer engagement and optimize user experience.

  • More about Jonathan

I've lived an unconventional life and embrace it.

At 12, I created my first business. Started freelance editorial photography in junior high. Graduated high school at 17 and college at 20.

In 2015, I transitioned to being a full﻿-﻿time, independent front-end developer. Five months later, Landed a global brand as a client and worked with them non﻿-﻿stop for over two years.

Most my practical education has been on the proverbial “street”. I'm a continual learner — always observation, listening and questioning. The past several years, I've been primarily a front﻿-﻿end developer and am entirely self﻿-﻿taught. My formal education is in graphic design and art. In between, I've worn a lot of other hats.

Empathy, honesty and clarity are crucial to communication. They are the basis for effective interactions.
